did.abstract: Letters describing troop movements across the Georgia mountains in 1863, commodity prices, Confederate evacuation of breastworks at Resaca, Georgia, voting for Abraham Lincoln for president, the desire to devastate South Carolina in retaliation for having initiated hostilities, the burning of Atlanta, and the march from Savannah, Georgia, to Fayetteville, North Carolina. Herr criticized his "treasonous" family for showing sympathy for the Confederacy. Also included are references to financial affairs in Ohio.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John Herr was a corporal, 94th Regiment, Ohio Volunteer Infantry, from Donnelsville (Clark County), Ohio.
